comment: Overall she had very good lectures online and made tests/quizzes super easy since they were pretty much based entirely on those. My main issue was she was a tough grader with discussions/homework and never really provided feedback so it was hard to understand what we did wrong. Other than that, this course was easy if you follow her schedule.

She's a good professor, but does not provide a lot of extra credit if you are close to a higher grade. Also, the tests mean A LOT in this class, so study for them. There are 3 lockdown tests. She is also a tough grader when it comes to writing assignments. She is very accessible and always offers help to her students.

Dr. Dunagin is a great professor. However, for this course, be ready to do some work. Her lectures are broken up so you are not taking all the material at once. She drops some quizzes. You have worksheets and discussions, but they are not terrible. Her tests are locked down, but if you study the quizzes, you will be fine.

Theres a lecture, quiz, reading stuff, and new key terms every week so it can be a lot there were a few assignments, discussion posts. The tests were kind of hard, lockdown webcam, two writing parts and an essay portion. Just study really well. Probably don't take if you work a lot.

do not take her, find someone else. lots of work, 2 exams and 1 final but they are all on lockdown with camera. weekly quizzes no lockdown. makes it difficult to find the due dates on things so make sure you find them first, or you will be behind. takes a while to respond and does not grade things fast takes like a month to find your grade.

very harsh grader, a bunch of work to do for the class, 3 exams, 2 exams and 1 final. all on lockdown with camera. the quizzes are not on lockdown or camera. just overall a lot of work for an online class, i would not take this again or recommend unless want to have a lot of work to do every week.

She is a very nice professor and responds fast, however the workload for the class is very heavy considering it is an online gen ed class. Her tests are lockdown with camera so keep that in mind. She grades harshly and the work can be confusing at times. I would take another prof if you can especially if you have a lot of other classes.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: definitely recommend her if you don't mind sitting through speaking videos! her lectures were engaging, you can tell she's passionate of what she's teaching. assignments were heavily focused on her videos, and exams were fair in terms of difficulty.

The video lectures can be a chore to listen to due to the amount of filler words, but they're not too long. All the quiz questions come from the lectures and the test uses the quiz questions. However, the test does have written portions that are all from the study guide the professor gives us. Sometimes we have worksheets, but they're not too bad.

Her workload is excessive for an online general education class. There are three exams, and they're demanding. Grading is strict, especially for discussion posts and worksheets. The written potion of her exams include defining two terms from three randomly chosen ones and writing an essay on a question she chooses. It's challenging but manageable.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: I loved her! I took her online class and the way she has her modules are by far the best organized. Her video lectures and external sources she provides for each module are clearly structured for you to pass the quizzes and exams if you take notes and pay attention. Her exams are lockdown with webcam but her weekly quizzes are not. Take her!

Not hard work just a lot of work... for an online class definitely feels like it was a bit tedious but not anything hard. Never took notes just watched the video lectures and studied quizlets and such for exams. Exams are lockdown + webcam, quizzes were not lockdown. Turnaround for grading was awful, takes about 3 weeks to figure out exam scores...

She's honestly not a bad teacher, she uploads lecture videos. I will say there are only 3 exams (2 test and a final exam) so u have to do good on those. Her exams are on lockdown browsers which I'm not a fan of but her quizzes aren't and they're super easy if you just take notes. The workload was just a little too much for me for an online class.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: Had 3 exams (lockdown and webcam). 15 modules with about 30-90 min lectures. Module quizzes aren't on lockdown. expect other assignments as well. She helped a lot and was willing to meet with you whenever needed. Be sure to study a lot, the exams have 1 short answer & 1 essay & she is very specific about grading things. Time consuming but not bad.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Lecture heavy

comment: She is a great professor. Her lectures are easy to understand. Do keep in mind her tests are lockdown browser and webcam monitored, but her tests and assignments are not too difficult so take her if you want an A in the class.

Dr. Dunagin is amazing! She teaches the content in a way that is interesting and easy to understand. Definitely take her. I only took this class because it worked with my schedule, but she was able to make the content enjoyable. Very fair grader as well! As long as you put the effort in, you'll do well.

For the online class, there were some weeks where there was a lot of work, but overall it was not that bad. I highly recommend not procrastinating the work and trying to do it bit by bit throughout the week. Dr. Dunagin is super kind and the layout of the course is easy to follow. If you can handle an online class, I would take this one.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: I took her Survey of World History 2, we had 3 exams all not cumulative but over the past modules that we went over. VIDEO LECTURE HEAVY!! have to watch these videos and take a quiz about that module ALL before the beginning of next weeks class. u have ID terms that you have to remember for each module n those r wat u have to remember 4 the exams.

All lectures are given through short compiled d2l videos ranging 50-1hr long, you go to class basically to ask questions, quizzes for each unit, if you like to learn by yourself go ahead but if you like in class notes beware, fine on everything else.

The class consists of discussion posts, 10-question quizzes, and 3 exams. Exams are lockdown browser and webcam with a writing portion. The quizzes, discussion posts, and assignments are pretty straightforward to prepare for. The exams are a little more throughout but if you do the study guide it helps prepare you for the exam and writing portion.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Accessible outside class

comment: Passionate on what she teaches. All of her quizzes come from her lectures which are a few short videos every week. The MC questions on the exams are from the quizzes. She does use lockdown browser, but if you study the multiple choice questions before hand and the choice of essay questions she gives you, you'll be fine.

Dr. Dunagin is great! Her lectures on each module are broken up into 5 - 12 minute parts which are great if you have a short attention span like me. Quizzes come straight from lectures and tests come straight from quizzes. Worksheets and discussions aren't every week which makes them not as bad. Would reccomend!

Super passionate about history! I thought she would grade harshly due to what I read on here, they are WRONG. She is super nice and even though it was not my favorite section of history, she made it as interesting as possible. She is super responsive and kind when she does respond. There are readings daily but its normal work for college. 10/10!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Caring

comment: if you put in the effort to watch her video lectures the class is super easy. all of the quiz questions come directly from her lectures, and a majority of the test multiple choice questions come directly from the quizzes. the discussion boards and worksheets are the only slight difficult part, but if you just write a solid paragraph youll be fine.

tough grader and i feel as if she looks for really specific things. when I asked her about something, she didn't help which made me get a low grade on the assignment. wouldn't take again and wish I had picked someone better.

Unless you already like world history, this isn't the class for you. This is obviously a required class for everyone in Kennesaw, but she's treating it as if it's a major class for everyone who signed up. Quizzes are easy but assignments and test... not so much. Regret picking her so much
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: Super nice, knows a lot about history, but treats this gen-ed world history class like a core class. The weekly assignments, lecutre videos, discussion, etc not bad. But the tests are way too much- expect 30 mc q's, 2 short answer (1 para each), and a full on essay to be done in 90 minutes with lockdown and webcam. Don't take if have lot classes
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Test heavy

comment: Dr. Dunagin is a nice professor and very helpful but she treats this class as if it were a core class and it looks like she thinks that everyone is taking this class to be a historian. she uses browser lock down for tests and some of the questions on the quizzes were tricky . she makes an elective unnecessarily complicated than it needs to be.

Professor Dunagin is very understanding and caring! She responds quickly to emails and is willing to clarifiy any questions you may have. I took this class online so I had to watch a lot of recorded lectures and take a lot of notes which was time consuming. You have weekly quizzes which are super easy if you listen to the lectures and 3 tests.

I took professor Dunagin in the Fall. Amazing professor, really passionate about English history and this comes out in her lectures. I was able to get an A because of prior knowledge but if you have no prior knowledge of English history be sure to pay attention in class and be prepared to read. I wish her class next semester worked with my schedule
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: Her class was very straight forward. She posted her lectures weekly and we would take a quiz weekly and then take the unit quiz which was based from the quizzes. There are some worksheet assignments and vocabulary to fill out every unit, but it is simple. I recommend her.

Dr. Dunagin is very passionate about history and genuinely wants her students to succeed. She requires a good bit of group discussion, but she never calls on anyone who doesnt want to speak in front of the class and her assignments are very doable if you pay attention in class.

Shes the BEST! Take her for any history. She knows her stuff and makes the boring topic very interesting. She is caring and understanding and her tests are super easy if you come to class and pay attention.

I've read a few of the other reviews for professor Dunagin. Several of them focus on the fact that she acts as though she is teaching at Yale and not Kennesaw State University. This is essentially the truth of it. I managed an A without the textbooks, although it requires time studying the content out of class. She can grade harshly, so be careful.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Amazing teacher! Professor Dunagin definitely knows her history and is an amazing lecturer and always manages to keep things interesting! Genuinely cares about her students and doesn't force anyone to speak up in front of the class which is great for those with anxiety. Tests do require a lot of preparation and studying but I loved the class!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--Caring

comment: She went to yale or something so she goes in a lot of detail. Lectures are long. Tests are matching section, then one paragraph explaining a term three times and answering an essay question. Shes really nice but wants class participation otherwise she gets mad. Come to class otherwise your grade drops.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: So enthusiastic & knowledgable about her field. Lectures in a way that allows you to learn & stay interested at the same time. Organized & detail oriented. You take a survey after each test and she actually listens and changed an aspect of the test. Pay attention during lecture and study a normal amount and you will do well. 10/10 would recommend.

If you simply attend class everyday, sit up front, and pay attention, everything else will fall into place. You're only tested on material that is covered in class. I don't know what it was about her, but I had the highest grade I've ever made in a history class in my life because of her. She also gives out a lot of extra credit.

I personally loved Professor Dunagin's class. She is very passionate about history and you can clearly see it during her lectures. One of her main goals is to get you to understand the significance of historical events and not just memorizing them. It is not an easy class but as long as you put in some effort you will do fine.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: DO NOT take this class if you have no genuine interest in history. It is a gen ed course but is taught at a vey advanced level. She lectures the entire class but the tests are nothing like the lectures. You won't pass the test if you don't know all 30+ ID terms (like vocab words) in extreme depth. Textbook required but you won't ever use it.

Dunagin knows her history but spent too many years at Yale. She expects everyone to know wayyyy too much about history. Almost like she doesn't realize it's an intro class. I know history pretty well and still it was overwhelming to me. She gets distracted easily and don't bother disputing something because she will not see your point. Kinda snobby
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: She's not bad, goes off her ppt, including her tests and quizzes. 10, 3 question pop quizzes. A few essays but she gives enough time and is willing to give good feedback if you ask. You are given 25-35 ID terms to know and 3-5 essay questions. For the test, you define 7/10 she lists and one essay. Got a much lower grade on the final than the test.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Definitely knows her stuff but she's not the best lecturer. Would go off on tangents about stuff we didn't need to know and then wouldn't cover all the material we needed to in class for the tests. Overshares her personal opinions and gets very defensive if you challenge them. Acts like she's going to be a tough grader but she really isn't.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Dr. Dunagin was a great teacher. She was powerpoint heavy and her powerpoints were enough to get you through the tests. All of her tests are 100% writing but she does give a lot of wiggle room if it seems like you know what you're talking about. I got an A on every assignment, test, and quiz by just looking over powerpoints.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: An amazing professor. Show up to class and complete all your assignments there is no reason you shouldn't pass. A few papers but she grades them really easy to help your grade. Her test do require heavy preparation but don't be surprised when it makes the test really easy. Test are not multiple choice but not difficult. I am not good at history...

Do you enjoy British dramas and want to really understand the historical context? Dr. Dunagin loves her subject and is expert at teaching it. Lectures and readings stress concepts, not dry facts, though there are plenty of those. Tests and papers cover a lot of ground but are graded fairly, and she's great at leading discussions.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: Dr. Dunagin is very passionate about history. Her tests were hard to me, just because I struggle with memorization, if you do not, you'll be fine! Tests are all memorized (5 W's) and an essay-- all provided before the exam (this helps a lot!) 2 papers! She gives good feedback, and is very nice!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Get ready to read

comment: Dr. Dunagin is awesome I love her lectures and the readings. But if you don't like history she might be a harder teacher for you. Her tests are pretty straightforward and so are the other assignments but it's a lot of reading.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Her tests are all written but she does grade off a really easy scale. Pop quizzes once a week over the reading but they're pretty general questions. She's super sweet and will help you as much as she can. There are two papers but she is very forgiving when grading prose, so nothing to really stress over. Overall, I think she's a great professor.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Professor Dunagin was a very good professor that was very knowledgeable in what she taught. Her exams were 5 ID terms out of the 8 on the board where you had to write a paragraph about each term, and one short essay out of 2 on the board. Overall, I liked her, but some of my peers always talked about how she asked too much of us in the exams.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I would recommend this professor. If you pay attention to her lectures on powerpoints and take notes you will be successful. Pop quizzes, 3 major exams, a couple papers. Go to class or you wont pass. 3 free skips. STUDY STUDY STUDY for exams. They are part essay. Be specific!!!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: When she told us the exams were all written I thought I was going to fail... But turns out I was completely wrong. Even if you might not know something on the test she still gives you credit. I never read the textbook but I did go to every class. As long as you study the ID terms and know the 5 W's you should easily make an A in the class.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Caring

comment: Dr. Dunagin is a very sophisticated and lively professor. This is only my first year, but she is one of the most well informed and structured teacher Ive ever had. Her tests are intimidating, but if you do the work, you will definitely pass with flying colors. I made an A on every assignment even though I was convinced i did poorly. Great prof!

It is very apparent that Dr. Dunagin is well versed in the subject matter she teaches, and I can tell she cares a lot about sharing this knowledge with her students. She does expect you to work for your grade, but if you do, you will have no trouble in this class. This has been my experience. She is also very helpful outside of class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Dunagin lectures every class period based off of her own powerpoints. The powerpoints are super detailed, and she posts them on D2L. Before a test, she makes a google doc of the study guide, so everyone works on it together using her powerpoints. All you have to do is read and remember the study guide and you'll make an A on the tests.

She is the most boring lecturer I have ever had. I had originally not been a fan of world history, she made me dislike it even more. It is just such a boring class. When she lectures, she says "um and uh" between every other sentence. Her tests consist of no multiple choice, just who what where when why written answers for 10 terms chosen from 30.
